post.summary: Export all subject data from Zoho Desk
post.description: This API exports data related to the subject, from your Zoho Desk portal.

get.description: This API fetchs possible fileds list and conditions

parameters.name: module
parameters.description: Name of the modules from which the resources must be fetched. Values allowed are @tickets@ and @contacts@. If you want to fetch resources from both modules, pass the value @allEntities@.

schema.description: Name of the modules from which the resources must be fetched. Values allowed are @tickets@ and @contacts@. If you want to fetch resources from both modules, pass the value @allEntities@.

get.description: This API fetches the details of a particular SAR.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Additional information related to the request. Values allowed are: @createdBy@ and @modifiedBy@. You can pass multiple values by separating them using commas in the API request.

schema.description: Additional information related to the request. Values allowed are: @createdBy@ and @modifiedBy@. You can pass multiple values by separating them using commas in the API request.

patch.description: This API updates the details of a particular SAR.

post.summary: Erase all subject data from Zoho Desk
post.description: This API erases data related to the subject, from your Zoho Desk portal.

get.description: This API lists a particular number of subject access requests, based on the limit specified.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Period in which the requests were made. Values allowed are: @TODAY@, @LAST_24_HOURS@, @LAST_7_DAYS@, @LAST_30_DAYS@, @CURRENT_WEEK@, and @CURRENT_MONTH@.

schema.description: Period in which the requests were made. Values allowed are: @TODAY@, @LAST_24_HOURS@, @LAST_7_DAYS@, @LAST_30_DAYS@, @CURRENT_WEEK@, and @CURRENT_MONTH@.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Additional information related to the requests. Values allowed are: @createdBy@ and @modifiedBy@. You can pass multiple values by separating them using commas in the API request.

schema.description: Additional information related to the requests. Values allowed are: @createdBy@ and @modifiedBy@. You can pass multiple values by separating them using commas in the API request.

parameters.name: contactEmailId
parameters.description: Email ID of the contact who made the request.

schema.description: Email ID of the contact who made the request.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of requests to list. The default value is @10@ and the maximum value supported is @100@.

schema.description: Number of requests to list. The default value is @10@ and the maximum value supported is @100@.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Index number, starting from which the requests must be fetched.

schema.description: Index number, starting from which the requests must be fetched.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Processing status of the request. Values allowed are: @INITIATED@, @INPROGRESS@, @COMPLETED@, @CANCELED@, @EXPORTED@, @PARTIALLY_COMPLETED@, @PARTIALLY_EXPORTED@ and @FAILED@. You can pass multiple values by separating them using commas in the API request.

schema.description: Processing status of the request. Values allowed are: @INITIATED@, @INPROGRESS@, @COMPLETED@, @CANCELED@, @EXPORTED@, @PARTIALLY_COMPLETED@, @PARTIALLY_EXPORTED@ and @FAILED@. You can pass multiple values by separating them using commas in the API request.

post.description: This API exports specific resources related to a subject access request.

post.summary: Get count of resources related to request
post.description: This API returns the number of resources related to a subject access request.
This API erases specific resources related to a subject access request.

x-custom-parameters-attributes.descrption: Email ID of the contact who made the request.
Filter by type of the request. Values allowed are: @ACCESS_REQUEST@, @ERASURE_REQUEST@. You can pass multiple values by separating them using commas in the API request.

Processing status of the request. Values allowed are: @INITIATED@, @INPROGRESS@, @COMPLETED@, @CANCELED@, @EXPORTED@, @PARTIALLY_COMPLETED@, @PARTIALLY_EXPORTED@ and @FAILED@. You can pass multiple values by separating them using commas in the API request.
Email ID of the user who made the request.
Name of the modules from which the resources must be fetched. Values allowed are @tickets@ and @contacts@. If you want to fetch resources from both modules, pass the value @allEntities@.
ID of the ticket in which the subject access request was made
Processing status of the request. Value allowed is @CANCELED@.
Email ID of the user who made the request.
ID of the ticket in which the subject access request was made.
